reason: Bitcoin is currently in a markdown phase, evidenced by its brief fall below $90,000 amidst a reported 'meltdown,' indicating significant selling pressure and heightened volatility. While there are strong positive long-term signals from regulatory developments (CFTC chief championing crypto) and institutional interest (Mastercard exploring Zerohash), these fundamental tailwinds are not immediately offsetting the current bearish price action. Ecosystem development funding (Solayer) also points to underlying growth. The market presents conflicting signals: immediate price weakness against a backdrop of strengthening institutional and regulatory acceptance, warranting extreme caution and close observation.
headlines: Solayer unveils $35 million fund for real-time DeFi, AI and tokenization apps on infiniSVM
Mastercard said to weigh Zerohash investment after crypto company ends takeover talks
Trump Media sets date for airdrop of digital tokens to DJT shareholders
Bitcoin falls briefly below $90,000 amid meltdown: Markets Liveblog
Trump's new CFTC chief Selig starts 'future-proof' initiative to champion crypto
